fields.description:
When one of the cloud controllers in an HA topology is restarted the other cloud controller can deadlock when adding the host until the database synchronization wait times out:

{code}

The thread processing the host map state change becomes blocked by some other thread that is blocked in a state transition due to the database synchronization. The database synchronization cannot complete as the host map is in the process of updating.

This causes the primary cloud controller to be unresponsive for a few minutes until the wait for database synchronization times out.
fields.summary: Restart of cloud controller in HA can cause deadlock

comments.body: I think this is addressed by changes made for EUCA-6479.
If this issue is addressed then you should not see long (10 minutes or so) periods when the cloud controllers are unresponsive after a restart.

Fix Verified.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.4.0
Release     : 0.0.1628.20131012git43ee8e45.el6

Performed several failovers observing very short times were CLCs were unresponsive.
HA redesign will be evaluated in later releases of euca.
